title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1. DEMAND FOR HEALTH, NUT & HIV SERVICES

description.narrative: By end 2021, parents, pregnant women, women of reproductive age, mothers and adolescents have the knowledge, financial resources and social empowerment to access quality health services,which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1. By the end of 2021, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women, mothers and children 0-5 years of age are using more quality health services in the 10 targeted provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, parents, pregnant women, women of reproductive age, mothers and adolescents have the knowledge, financial resources and social empowerment to access quality health services

description.narrative: Advocacy and training of political, administrative and traditional leaders and the mobilization of civil society networks strengthened engagement of these actors in the implementation of supplementary and routine vaccination activities, particularly in Lac province and in Ndjamena. As a result, 91 per cent of parents of children aged 0 to 59 months were informed of the polio campaign at the national level prior to its launch in March 2019. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020
